stories.text: When working on a project, I have been finding tools that have a last modified date of some significant time, usually a year or more.  There are some projects that have a last release of years ago, but still have active work done without any new release on the horizon.  So I ask, when is a project to old to use?
stories.title: Ask HN: When Is a Project Too Old?

stories.text:
https://www.knowforwork.com/

I am looking for people that run businesses that want to try a new way to grow their paying customers. I built a referral marketing platform that uses vouchers to attract new paying customers. The idea is for each referral someone makes, they get a voucher and so does the person being referred.

Let say your product is $100 and you give a $10 off voucher. If someone refers their friend to your product/service, both of them gets to buy your product/service for $90. You are earning less per person, but as a whole, you now have 1 more customer that can pay $180.

I am targeting businesses that can sell their product/service as a package. We help manage your vouchers and we don't restrict you on how your customers purchase. It's entirely up to you how those vouchers are used. The platform is free to use. If you want to try it out, just fill out this form (https://www.knowforwork.com/list-company).

You can also check out our app on iOS: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/know-for-work/id1576175034 Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.knowforwork.app
stories.title: Show HN: I built a platform to help businesses grow paying customers
